polito.uomm

Class IDM_LC

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.uni_stuttgart.informatik.canu.mobisim.core.ExtensionModule
      • de.uni_stuttgart.informatik.canu.mobisim.mobilitymodels.Movement
        • de.uni_stuttgart.informatik.canu.uomm.UserOrientedMovement
          • de.uni_stuttgart.informatik.canu.uomm.IntelligentDriverMotion
            • polito.uomm.IDM_IM
              • polito.uomm.IDM_LC
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NotificationListener, XMLStreamable

    public class IDM_LC
extends IDM_IM
    This class implements Intelligent Driver Motion with Intersection Management behavior. The implementation is based on M. Treiber and D. Helbing, "Explanation of Observed Features of Self-Organization in Traffic Flow", Preprint cond-mat/9901239 (1999). Original Intersection Management added.

    Version:
    0.6
    Author:
    Marco Fiore

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected float athr
      Threshold acceleration for lane change, must be below the acceleration IDM parameter 'a' (in meters/ms^2)
      protected float biasRight
      Constant value to increase advantage in moving to right lane to reflect real drivers behavior (in meters/ms^2)
      protected float bsave
      Maximum safe deceleration (in meters/ms^2)
      protected float minGap
      Minimum distance between cars when changing lane (in meters)
      protected float p
      Politeness factor

      • computeAcceleration

        protected float computeAcceleration(Node backNode,
                                    Node frontNode)
        Returns new IDM acceleration between two nodes.

        Parameters:
        backNode - the back Node
        frontNode - the ahead Node
        Returns:
        the acceleration of the backNode, if frontNode is the node ahead of it

      • changeLane

        Performs lane change according to the MOBIL lane changing model

        Recalculates the vehicle's speed

      • act

        public int act()
        Executes the extension.

        The method is called on every simulation timestep.
        Overrides:
        act in class IDM_IM
        Returns:
        0 - the module should be executed on next timesteps, -1 - the module should not be executed on further timesteps and should be removed from the extensions' list
